items.title: Nicole Kidman cites ‘irreconciliable differences’ in divorce papers
items.standfirst: Nicole Kidman has filed for divorce from Kieth Urban and is seeking to be the “primary residential parent” just a day after the separation went public.
items.content: Nicole Kidman has filed for divorce from Kieth Urban and is seeking to be the “primary residential parent” just a day after the separation went public.

items.title: Nicole Kidman files for divorce from Keith Urban after 19 years of marriage
items.standfirst: Nicole Kidman has filed for divorce from Keith Urban after 19 years of marriage.
items.content: Nicole Kidman has filed for divorce from Keith Urban after 19 years of marriage, bringing a surprising end to a long and seemingly successful union that brought together two superstars from the worlds of movies and music.The 58-year-old Oscar-winning actor petitioned on Tuesday to end her marriage to the 57-year-old Grammy-winning country singer in a Nashville court. The documents state the couple has undergone "marital difficulties and irreconcilable differences."Kidman and Urban, two of the biggest stars to come out of Australia in recent decades, have been red carpet fixtures throughout their two-decade relationship, with Urban joining his wife at the Oscars and Kidman attending music events like the Academy of Country Music Awards.READ MORE: Trump threatens retribution as US government teeters on brink of shutdownThe filings include a marriage dissolution and childcare plan agreed on by the couple and submitted for a judge's approval."The mother and father will behave with each other and each child so as to provide a loving, stable, consistent and nurturing relationship with the child even though they are divorced," says the permanent parenting plan, using language common in the state's divorces."They will not speak badly of each other or the members of the family of the other parent. They will encourage each child to continue to love the other parent and be comfortable in both families."The plan asks that Kidman be the primary residential parent to the couple's two daughters, ages 17 and 14, having them for 306 days per year with Urban taking them for the other 59.The girls have lived in Nashville all their lives, and the documents give no indication that will change.READ MORE: Brisbane doctor revealed as mother found dead alongside daughterThe marriage dissolution plan lays out a roughly equal division of joint assets, with each keeping all the assets that are in their own name, including the copyrights and royalties for their artistic work.The detailed agreements suggests that the divorce had been in the works for well over a month at the least. Urban signed the parenting plan on August 29, Kidman on September 6.It will take at least 90 days for the divorce to become final under Tennessee law.Representatives for Kidman and Urban did not respond to emailed requests for comment on Tuesday.Both raised in Australia, Kidman and Urban met in 2005 at a Los Angeles event honouring Australians and were married in Sydney the following year.READ MORE: The one thing that's even more important than your sunscreen's SPF ratingThe marriage was the first for Urban and the second for Kidman, who was married to Tom Cruise from 1990 to 2001. Kidman also has two older children with Cruise.The couple had publicly but lovingly described some marital difficulties, but there were still few if any signs they were headed for divorce. Media reports of their separation came just a day before the divorce filing.Last year at the premiere of the Netflix series The Perfect Couple, Kidman told The Associated Press the term didn't apply to her and Urban."You're heading for trouble if you consider yourselves the perfect couple," she said. "I'm not a believer in perfect."A few months earlier, Urban paid tribute to Kidman, and brought her to tears, when she received the AFI Life Achievement Award.Urban said she showed him "what love in action really looks like" when his substance abuse problems emerged almost immediately after they wed in 2006."Four months into our marriage, I'm in rehab for three months," Urban said. "Nic pushed through every negative voice, I'm sure even some of her own, and she chose love. And here we are 18 years later."Kidman's film roles have included Days of Thunder, Eyes Wide Shut, Moulin Rouge and The Hours, for which she won an Academy Award for playing author Virginia Woolf.She has more recently worked in television, including the series Nine Perfect Strangers and Big Little Lies, for which she won Emmys as both actor and producer.Urban has been a major country star since the 1990s, with hits including Somebody Like You and Blue Ain't Your Color. He has won four Grammy Awards and more than a dozen ACM Awards.Their split was first reported by TMZ.

ai_summary: Nicole Kidman filed for divorce from Keith Urban.
She cited "irreconcilable differences" in the divorce papers.
Kidman is seeking to be the primary residential parent.
The divorce filing came after 19 years of marriage.
The separation became public shortly before the filing.

clusters.title: Footprint found as desperate search for missing four-year-old continues
clusters.neutral_headline: Search Continues for Missing Four-Year-Old Boy

items.title: Footprint found as desperate search for missing four-year-old continues
items.standfirst: Police have admitted they are increasingly preparing for a tragic outcome, with four-year-old Gus having been missing for almost four days.
items.content: Police have admitted they are increasingly preparing for a tragic outcome, with four-year-old Gus having been missing for almost four days.

items.title: Footprint found as desperate search for missing boy continues for fifth day
items.standfirst: T he four-year-old has not been seen since he was playing on his family's homestead on Saturday.
items.content: South Australia Police officers have found a footprint as they desperately search for a four-year-old missing in the state's outback.But police have admitted they are increasingly preparing for a tragic outcome, with four-year-old Gus having been missing for almost four days.He was last seen playing on his family's homestead, about 40km south of Yunta, at 5pm on Saturday.READ MORE: The US government has been shut down. What does that mean? Gus is described as Caucasian, with long, blonde, curly hair.He was wearing a grey sun hat, a cobalt blue t-shirt with a yellow Minion character on the front, light grey long pants, and boots. Police and emergency services have searched the area since Saturday night, but have not been able to find the boy.Given the remoteness of the surroundings where he disappeared, police have been forced to prepare for tragic outcomes in this case."It's a long time, there's someone being without water, food or shelter so we just prepared the family for the fact that we might not be able to find Gus alive," Superintendent Mark Syrus said.He said there was evidence of a footprint, which is a similar size to the shoes Gus would have been wearing when he was last seen.Syrus confirmed it was around 500m north of the property."That's consistent with which direction we anticipated he would have walked," Syrus said.READ MORE: One dead after driver crashes into two parked trucks with sleeping occupantsPolice are looking for similar evidence to help them in their search." We just need to find some evidence of where he's been. So we're looking for things like a hat or a boot, things like a four-year-old would discard when he's getting hot and confused," he said.A local tracker with deep knowledge of the terrain joined the operation yesterday to help find possible paths Gus may have taken, police said today."We've got the services of a specialist person in tracking, he's got a very close connection with the country," Syrus said."[He has a] very good connection with the land here, he has worked in this property and he knows it quite well."They also said a group of cadets were travelling to the property today to help the search.Aerial searches have continued throughout the nights, while ground searches in daylight hours have included SES, trail bikes, ATVs, dogs, and a drone. Water police and mounted police joined the search yesterday as it expanded to include dams and tanks on the property. READ MORE: Sunscreens are being pulled from Australian shelves over SPF claim concerns - so how are they actually tested?Gus' family issued a statement yesterday ."We are devastated by the disappearance of our beloved Gus on Saturday afternoon. This has come as a shock to our family and friends, and we are struggling to comprehend what has happened," the family said. "Gus's absence is felt in all of us, and we miss him more than words can express. Our hearts are aching, and we are holding onto hope that he will be found and returned to us safely."The family thanked police and volunteers and asked for privacy as the search continued. Anybody with information is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or online, and quote the reference number 250513. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: A four-year-old boy has been missing for almost four days, prompting a desperate search.
Police have admitted they are increasingly preparing for a tragic outcome in the search.
The boy was last seen playing on his family's homestead on Saturday.
A footprint was discovered during the ongoing search efforts for the missing child.
The search for the missing boy has entered its fifth day with no new leads.

items.title: One dead after driver crashes into parked trucks as people slept inside
items.standfirst: It is believed the driver lost control before crashing into two parked trucks on the Hume Freeway near Wangaratta South just before 5am today.
items.content: A driver has died after a truck crashed into two parked trucks - while people were sleeping inside them - and caught fire in north-east Victoria early today.It is believed the truck driver lost control before crashing into two parked trucks on the Hume Freeway near Wangaratta South just before 5am.The driver, who is yet to be identified, died at the scene.READ MORE: Trump's war chief opens fire on 'beardos' and the 'enemy within'The two occupants of the parked trucks were sleeping at the time and were not injured.Police are still investigating the circumstances around the crash.READ MORE: Brisbane doctor revealed as mother found dead alongside daughterAnyone who witnessed the incident or has dashcam or CCTV footage is urged to contact police or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
